Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees have been favorites in 110 games this season and won 61 (55.5%) of those contests.
New York has a record of 40-30 in games when sportsbooks favor them by at least -144 on the moneyline.
The implied probability of a win from the Yankees, based on the moneyline, is 59%.
The Cubs have been victorious in 34, or 47.9%, of the 71 contests they have been chosen as underdogs in this season.
Chicago has a mark of 12-10 in contests where oddsmakers favor it by +122 or worse on the moneyline.
The moneyline set for this matchup implies the Cubs have a 45% chance of coming away with a victory in the contest.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Aaron Judge paces the Yankees with 51 home runs and 125 runs batted in, while accumulating a team-high batting average of.323.
Juan Soto is hitting.295 with 28 doubles, four triples, 38 home runs and 112 walks.
Among all hitters in baseball, Judge is first in homers and first in RBI.
Ian Happ has managed a team-leading 23 home runs and has driven in 81 runs.
Among all hitters in MLB, Happ is 33rd in homers and 26th in RBI.
Nico Hoerner has 30 doubles, a triple, five home runs and 41 walks while batting.259.
